title.$t: ITS Maintenance Calendar

subtitle.$t: This calendar contains the planned and unplanned maintenance schedule and outages for IT services and systems. In addition, it contains the campus electrical power outages.

title.$t: High Network, IDM, AIS, ITR, and Support Center Activity due to SIRing.

summary.$t:
Recurring Event
First start: 2014-03-14 PDT
Duration: 345600
Event Status: confirmed

content.$t:
Recurring Event
First start: 2014-03-14 PDT
Duration: 345600
Event Status: confirmed
Event Description: Nov 29 - Dec 4: Extremely high system activity supporting the Fall Application process. Applications are received from UCOP, processed by AIS and IDM We had about 49,000 applicants for the Fall 2014 enrollment. We try to batch this work to help even the load. Dec 5-10: All applicants receive email from admissions informing them of their assigned information such as Cruz Id. We send in batches to help even the load. March 14-17: Applicants can login to MyUCSC to check their admissions status. This activity is extremely high. IDM, AIS, Network Services, APM database services, ITR just to name a few are critical during this time period. Applicants can begin to login on March 15th 12:01am (1 minute after midnight). The heaviest activity occurs the first 3-4 days hence the March 14-17 dates. May 1st: Deadline to SIR for Frosh. Heavy IDM (Cruz Id Mgr) activity. June 1st: Deadline to SIR for Transfers. Heavy IDM (Cruz Id Mgr) activity.

title.$t: Humanities1 Cut Over to new VOIP Telephone Infrastructure.

summary.$t:
Recurring Event
First start: 2014-04-07 09:00:00 PDT
Duration: 28800
Event Status: confirmed

content.$t:
Recurring Event
First start: 2014-04-07 09:00:00 PDT
Duration: 28800
Event Status: confirmed
Event Description: Why: As a component of the Telecommunications Infrastructure Upgrade (TIU) project the campus is designing an internally managed Voice over IP (VoIP) service and converting the campus to this platform. Converting the campus to Voice over IP (VoIP) service includes replacing current telephone sets with VoIP telephones. The first building to be converted is Humanities 1. What: Replacing the current digital and analog phone sets to VoIP. As each phone is transitioned to VoIP there will be a brief outage for that extension. Clients: Humanities Faculty and Staff in the Humanities 1 building. When: April 7th through 18th from 8 am to 5 pm. Communication: ITS is coordinating this work with the Humanities staff. Risk: There is a slight risk of some features not working as expected. We will be prepared to put users back on digital or analog phones if that becomes necessary.

title.$t: Telephone momentary outage at Hahn & OPERS for planned maintenance.

content.$t:
When: Tue Apr 15, 2014 9am to Thu May 1, 2014 4pm PDT

Event Status: confirmed
Event Description: During the moves individual phones may experience a momentary loss of dial tone. Why and What: As part of the TIU project ITS will move phone extension to a new voice systems platform. Note that this is an infrastructure change only. Phone sets and features will not change. During the moves individual phones may experience a momentary loss of dial tone. The schedule for April is as follows: Clients: Hahn When: April 14 - 30 from 9 am to 4 pm 7115 Hahn Student Services 7199 Hahn Art Facility 7726 OPERS Fitness Center 7753 OPE

title.$t: Planned Network maintenance. No outage expected.

summary.$t:
When: Mon Apr 21, 2014 12am to 4am  PDT

Who: ITS Maintenance Calendar
Event Status: confirmed

content.$t:
When: Mon Apr 21, 2014 12am to 4am PDT

Who: ITS Maintenance Calendar
Event Status: confirmed
Event Description: Sunesys, through CENIC, has scheduled a maintenance window to replace a damaged fiber cable in Santa Clara. There will be two or more outages of several minutes duration on the UCSC - Sunnyvale path during the window. The scheduled maintenance window is Monday 4/21/2014 00:01 - 04:00 PDT. Backup connectivity via Oakland will not be affected, and no service outage is expected. The impact of the work will be: Reduced path diversity for UCSC's CENIC DC and HPR network connections. Reduced path diversity for 2505 Augustine, Mt Hamilton, and Blue Oak Ranch Reserve Reduced path diversity for UCSC units at Moffett Field The CENIC HPR-L2 research connection will go down during splicing events. It is not in production service.

title.$t: Planned outage of UCSC Extension Higher Reach (UNEX Quick Admit).

content.$t:
When: Wed Apr 23, 2014 7am to 10am PDT

Event Status: confirmed
Event Description: The QuickAdmit site (course.ucsc-extension.edu) is scheduled to be taken offline at 7:00AM, with the upgrade process taking between 1 – 3 hours. The main site (www.ucsc-extension.edu) will continue to be fully functional with a maintenance notice posted, but customers will not be able to enroll in courses.

title.$t: eCommons planned outage for upgrade.

content.$t:
When: Sat Apr 26, 2014 7am to 9:30am PDT

Event Status: confirmed
Event Description: What: The eCommons CLE will be upgrade to Sakai 2.9.3.10. This upgrade provides significant improvements to the system and fixes problems that were discovered in December 2013. When: March 26, 2014 7am - 9am PDT. This date is after the end of the quarter and 24 hrs after grades are due. Clients Affected/ Communication Plan: During this outage Students, Faculty, and Staff will not be able to access eCommons. We will be placing a prominent notice, alerting users to the outage 48 hrs prior to the planned outage.
